fields.description: Triggers loads for all of the III administrative metadata type exporters you've defined and registered in the EXPORT_METADATA_TYPE_REGISTRY setting in your Django.settings file.
fields.label: Load ALL III administrative metadata-type data into Solr

fields.description: Exports bib records to Solr based on the provided filter and exports any attached records (items and holdings) to Solr as well.
fields.label: Load bibs and attached records into Solr

fields.description: Lets you export bibliographic records from Sierra and download them as MARC files.
fields.label: Download bib records as MARC

fields.description: Selects bibliographic records from Sierra and loads them into Solr using the BibsToSolr exporter. This exporter saves records to disk as MARC and uses SolrMarc to index them.
fields.label: Load bib records into Solr

fields.description: Loads Resource Records from Sierra into Solr.
fields.label: Load resource records into Solr

fields.description: Checks for new, updated, or deleted holding records and updates resources accordingly to add, update, or delete holdings.
fields.label: Check Holding records to update Resources

fields.description: Loads Item Statuses (codes and labels) into Solr.
fields.label: Load Item Statuses into Solr

fields.description: Loads item records into Solr based on the provided filter along with the parent bib records to which the items are attached.
fields.label: Load items and parent bibs into Solr

fields.description: Selects item records in Sierra and loads them into Solr using the ItemsToSolr exporter. This exporter uses Haystack to load items directly from the Sierra database.
fields.label: Load item records into Solr

fields.description: Loads your Itypes (codes and labels) into Solr. This always does a full reindex since the tables involved are so small--it just takes a few seconds to run.
fields.label: Load Itypes into Solr

fields.description: Exports all locations (including codes and labels) to Solr. This always performs a full reindex of these items since there are so few of them and the database query is so fast.
fields.label: Load locations (branches) into Solr

fields.description: No filter--selects all records in the Sierra database of a given type, depending on the export process ran.
fields.label: None (Full Export)

fields.description: Selects data added, updated, or deleted in Sierra since the time the last export process of this type ran.
fields.label: All data added or updated since last export

fields.description: Get records that match a particular location code.
fields.label: Filter by location code

fields.description: Selects records that have III record numbers that fall within a specified record range.
fields.label: Record Range (by record number)

fields.description: Selects records that were last updated in Sierra within a specified time period.
fields.label: Last Updated Date Range

fields.description: A job processed all of the records in the record set but encountered errors preventing one or more of the records from being processed.
fields.label: Finished, with Errors

fields.description: A job did not finish. The last error that occurred was fatal and prevented the job from processing all of the records in the record set.
fields.label: Unsuccessful (Errors)

fields.description: A job is currently being handled by a Celery worker process and is actively processing records. If a job gets stuck with this status, then it means the do_final_cleanup task didn't run to set the final status. It probably also means there are bugs somewhere in the export process or tasks.
fields.label: In Progress

fields.description: A job completed successfully with no errors. (Warnings do not prevent a "successful" status.)
fields.label: Successful

fields.description: An export job completed but for some reason it could not be determined whether the job finished successfully or with errors.
fields.label: Finished, status unknown

fields.description: The export job is waiting on the task scheduler to pick it up and process it. If a job is stuck with this status, check to make sure you have a Celery worker node running.
fields.label: Waiting
